item.title: UK October 2025 Gilt Auction Likely to Attract Strong Demand
item.description: The U.K. Debt Management Office’s sale of £4.25 billion in 3.5% October 2025 gilt on Wednesday is expected to draw strong demand as it is likely the penultimate tap of the gilt, RBC Capital Markets said.

item.title: Dollar Expected to Steam Ahead as Bond Yields Rise
item.description: The dollar’s strong gains should continue due to higher bond yields and the “relentless run of strong data,” including Tuesday’s bumper Jolts jobs data, ING said.

item.title: Oil Slides Ahead of Key OPEC Meeting
item.description: Oil prices fell ahead of a key OPEC meeting later, with Standard Chartered saying it is unlikely producers at the meeting will be less cautious around production due to uncertainties around the global economy and central-bank policy.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 2.3% as 10-Year JGB Yield Hits Decade High
item.description: Japanese stocks ended broadly lower, hit by growing concerns about higher borrowing costs, as the 10-year Japanese government bond yield reached a new decade high.

item.title: SAS Gets Rescue Deal From Castlelake-Led Investor Group
item.description: SAS is set to be taken over by an investor group led by Castlelake, which plans to pump over $1 billion into the struggling airline, averting the threat of bankruptcy.

item.title: Tesco Ups Profit Forecasts as Cost Cuts Boost Performance
item.description: Tesco now expects retail adjusted operating profit of between £2.6 billion and £2.7 billion for fiscal 2024, after significant cost reductions resulted in a strong performance in the first half.

item.title: Developer China SCE Seeks Suspension of Trading in Debt Securities
item.description: Property developer China SCE Group Holdings has sought the suspension of trading in its U.S. dollar-denominated notes on the Hong Kong exchange as it is facing an event of default.

item.title: Inside Ukraine's Strategy to Weaken Russia's Military in Crimea
item.description: As Ukraine continues its push to retake territory, Kyiv’s forces are increasingly attacking Russia’s logistics and military installations in Crimea. WSJ examines the strategy to weaken Russian forces on the occupied peninsula.

item.title: Some Americans Jailed in Russia Fear Being Left Behind
item.description: Detainees have failed to persuade the U.S. to deem them as wrongfully detained; ‘We’re just desperate.’

item.title: Bond Selloff Threatens Hopes for Soft Landing
item.description: Economic growth prospects—buoyed by consumer spending—and concern over government debt are driving long-term interest rates higher.

item.title: Netflix plans to raise the price of its ad-free service a few months after the continuing Hollywood actors strike ends, likely starting in the U.S. and Canada.
item.description: Netflix plans to raise the price of its ad-free service a few months after the continuing Hollywood actors strike ends, likely starting in the U.S. and Canada.

item.title: Intel intends to sell a stake in a division that makes programmable chips widely used in the defense and telecommunications industries.
item.description: Intel intends to sell a stake in a division that makes programmable chips widely used in the defense and telecommunications industries.

item.title: Hunter Biden pleaded not guilty to felony gun charges in a court appearance that underscored the heightened legal peril the president's son faces on several fronts.
item.description: Hunter Biden pleaded not guilty to felony gun charges in a court appearance that underscored the heightened legal peril the president’s son faces on several fronts.

item.title: U.S. officials announced indictments and sanctions against China-based companies and their employees related to the trafficking of chemicals used to manufacture large quantities of illicit fentanyl.
item.description: U.S. officials announced indictments and sanctions against China-based companies and their employees related to the trafficking of chemicals used to manufacture large quantities of illicit fentanyl.

item.title: An intensifying bond selloff sparked new stock-market losses, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow falling 1.4%, 1.9% and 1.3%, respectively. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose to 4.801%
item.description: An intensifying bond selloff sparked new stock-market losses, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow falling 1.4%, 1.9% and 1.3%, respectively. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose to 4.801%

item.title: A sudden surge in long-term interest rates to 16-year highs is threatening hopes for an economic soft landing, all the more because the exact triggers for the moves are unclear.
item.description: A sudden surge in long-term interest rates to 16-year highs is threatening hopes for an economic soft landing, all the more because the exact triggers for the moves are unclear.

item.title: The Nobel Prize in physics was awarded to three scientists whose research demonstrates a way to create extremely short pulses of light that can provide information about processes inside atoms and molecules.
item.description: The Nobel Prize in physics was awarded to three scientists whose research demonstrates a way to create extremely short pulses of light that can provide information about processes inside atoms and molecules.

item.title: Sens. Marsha Blackburn and Richard Blumenthal are seeking information about TikTok's executive transfers from ByteDance, its China-based parent company.
item.description: Sens. Marsha Blackburn and Richard Blumenthal are seeking information about TikTok’s executive transfers from ByteDance, its China-based parent company.

item.title: The U.S. funding system for Ukrainian salaries and Kyiv government expenditures is expected to run out in the next month absent a fresh infusion of money from Congress, Ukrainian and American government officials said.
item.description: The U.S. funding system for Ukrainian salaries and Kyiv government expenditures is expected to run out in the next month absent a fresh infusion of money from Congress, Ukrainian and American government officials said.

item.title: The House removed Rep. Kevin McCarthy as speaker, after a small band of GOP dissidents moved to oust the Republican leader and Democrats didn't come to his rescue during a dramatic vote with no precedent in U.S. history.
item.description: The House removed Rep. Kevin McCarthy as speaker, after a small band of GOP dissidents moved to oust the Republican leader and Democrats didn’t come to his rescue during a dramatic vote with no precedent in U.S. history.
